headline: Chicken Broccoli Salad
description: This broccoli salad is a great way to use up leftover grilled chicken. The tangy mayonnaise dressing is easy to whip up, too.
name: Chicken Broccoli Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 cooked skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cubed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine broccoli, chicken, walnuts, and green onions in a large bowl.
Whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar together in a bowl until well blended.
Pour mayonnaise dressing over broccoli mixture; toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate until chilled, if desired. Sprinkle with crumbled bacon to serve.

review.reviewBody: It was absolutely delicious! My husband had two bowl fulls and took the rest for lunch
Amazing ~ put over a bowl of greens and add olive oil drizzle to the top!
Added cherry tomatoes. Used leftover rotisserie chicken. Really good!

This is a great salad for summer: it's easy to put together, it tastes good, and it's filling. I didn't have walnuts on hand so I added celery for crunchiness. These ingredients do make a lot, but I think it would serve 8 better than 10. I paired it with macaroni salad, and toasted Italian bread! Yummy! I will make this again.
I made this without the bacon, for the nuts I chose walnuts. My family loved it!

I took the suggestion of throwing the broccoli in the microwave for one minute. Also, instead of plain walnuts, I added a craisin/glazed walnut salad topper from the salad section of the grocery store and mixed in two packages. I grilled the chicken breasts to add a little depth to the flavor. Turned out fantastic!
This salad is delicious. I did substitute 1/4 c. honey for the sugar.
I put freshly shredded cheese on top and then the bacon.
Made it as written. Big hit with family and friends. Passed on the recipe. Thanks!
I don't use any sugar in my household, so I used a stevia blend instead. I'm also picky with mixing any type of nuts with other foods. But other than that, I actually loved it.
Amazing! I subbed a 1/4 cup of honey mustard dressing for mayo and we could hardly stop eating it. So good.
Made it just like the recipe called for. Followed the tip of steaming the broccoli in the microwave for 4 minutes, then chilled it in the fridge immediately after. The salad was tasty.
DELICIOUS!!!!
Very tasty and super simple to prepare!

I loved this salad! But I did change it to one red onion instead of green. Tiny less sugar, add cherry tomatoes, and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.Also sliced hard boil egg on top with a sprinkle raisins on top! What a nice sweetness touch it made! Delicious!
Loved it added black olives . Also parsley to the dressing . A very pretty salad
I loved it. I am not a huge fan of broccoli usually but the dressing is amazing and makes it taste so good!

This was an awesome recipe. My husband and I loved it. I cut the recipe in half...grilled 4 boneless chicken thighs lightly seasoned with salt and pepper with my stovetop grill pan. Used sliced almonds as I didn't have walnuts, and threw in sliced orange pepper and a half a red apple coarsely chopped. Threw the bacon and the chicken still warm into the salad and ate it immediately. Will definitely be saving this recipe for future use.

This salad is exceptional! I adore the bacon/chicken combo it is super in this salad. Love the crunch of the walnuts. Simply added S&P to the dressing before whisking it up. I used raw broccoli. Thanks for sharing
I made this exactly as the recipe called for. I used seasoned salt on the chicken and sauteed it in olive oil. My husband and I thought it was so good that I am making it again tomorrow!
A great discovery! I microwaved the broccoli just enough to leave it still crispy. It's worth the time to fry up the bacon. The combination of flavors was just right!

The chicken & broccoli mixture was good. I used chicken cooked with lemon & herbs. Since we have nut allergies, I omitted the nuts and added craisins and half a bell pepper diced and half a cucumber diced.

Excellent! Subbed honey for the sugar by warming up the vinegar slightly, stirring in the honey, then mixing in. Also added a few cut up dried cherries and a little bit of freshly ground black pepper.

Uber yummy! Made some substitutions: skipped the bacon and added a cup of raisins, used agave instead of sugar and reduced the mayo. My husband (the picky eater) wanted to know what I was going to eat for the rest of the week. A household WIN!!

I thought this salad was very good, with a nice combination of flavors that went very well together. I even tried some without bacon (GASP!) and found it to be equally as good as the portions that included bacon. Thanks for sharing this recipe, JeriM in Austin, TX!

Made this for dinner one hot night and my wife and son both loved it. Tonight I'm omitting the chicken and adding orange bell pepper and using it for a side with grilled pork loin from this site and mac n' cheese.
This has very little flavor. Neither my husband thought it was worth making again.
An excellent main dish salad! I added a yellow bell pepper, slivered almonds, craisins, and small grape tomatoes. It looked and tased wonderful! Thanks for a great recipe.
Delicious, never had this before and I've always hated Waldorf salad so I was leery. Excellent, thanks for the recipe!
Very Tasty! How could you go wrong; fresh veges, chicken and bacon- YUM! We had this for dinner and there are no leftovers.

Fantastic salad! I don't use sugar, so subbed honey instead. Fried up a whole pkg of uncured bacon and added to the salad instead of sprinkling on top as a garnish. The dressing is perfect! Will make this salad A LOT!! There is a lot, but leftovers will be perfect for lunches.
Great summer salad. I added half a red apple, chopped small, and that extra sweetness added a lot. I put the salad on top of lettuce when I served it.
Easy to make, healthy with healthy substitutions available to make it healthier. Wonderful picnic or party cover dish to share!
i used sweet vidalia onion dressing instead and it is fantastic :) thank you for posting this :)
This was the perfect warm weather meal! I followed the directions exactly with the exception of reducing the sugar in half
